main event: A witness reported seeing a bright, amber-colored UFO with a reddish tint over Macon, Georgia on March 14, 1967.
interesting points: The object was round, about the size of a dime at arm's length, and seemed to be suspended instantly under broken clouds.
The witness first noticed a small, bright red light before observing the full UFO.
The object remained stationary at an elevation of 20-40 degrees for approximately 30 minutes.
The Air Force investigator determined the object may have been the regular star 'Leo', which was in the same location and color as the reported UFO.
No photographs were included in the report.
sighted object: one round, bright amber-colored object with a reddish tint
witnesses: one witness, a 19-year-old male college student
